Gelson Martins vs Dortmund (2-11-2016) Champions League Group Stage (Round 4)

Napoli Eye Left-Back Replacements as Algerian Star's Links to Liverpool Gather Pace
Published on: 08 June 2017



Serie A club Napoli are preparing for life without Faouzi Ghoulam by monitoring other left-back targets after reports linking the Algerian to Liverpool increased.

The 26-year-old has established himself as one of the Italian top division's best full-backs, and has apparently made it onto Liverpool's wish list in recent weeks.
FBL-ITA-SERIEA-TORINO-NAPOLI
He has just finished his third season with Napoli after joining from Ligue 1 side Saint-Etienne in 2014, and may move to the Premier League if an offer comes in.

Jurgen Klopp is understood to be keen on Ghoulam becoming the first choice left-back at Anfield next season, after it emerged as somewhat of a problem position in 2016/17.
FBL-EUR-C1-NAPOLI-DYNAMO
James Milner provided cover for pretty much the whole season after Alberto Moreno failed to stake a strong claim for the position, and the Englishman started the campaign strongly.

Milner is paper over the cracks though, and a move for Ghoulam would likely be a sensible move - contact is expected soon between club and the player's representatives according to the â€‹Star.
FBL-ENG-LCUP-SOUTHAMPTON-LIVERPOOL
Reds officials will be hoping for a more straightforward transfer for him than that of Virgil van Dijk - that move appears to have collapsed following accusations of illegal 'tapping up' and feeding of details of price to the media by the club.

Napoli are supposedly already eyeing Bordeaux's Adam Ounas and Osasuna's Alex Berenguer, as they prepare for the possibility of losing Ghoulam.

Sporting CP willing to sell Liverpool target Gelson Martins for LESS than buyout clause

by Paul Vegasan hour ago


Sporting CP are playing hardball with Liverpool over their interest for Gelson Martins.

The Daily Mail says the Reds have been in negotiations with Roma about Mohamed Salah, but fear being priced out of a move for the Egypt international, and Martins is seen as a potential option.

It has been claimed in Portugal that Martins has a buy-out clause of £52 million, but that Sporting's failure to qualify for the Champions League means they would take £43.5m.

Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is known to want to add more pace to his side for next term. It is understood the club have also been monitoring Keita Balde at Lazio and Bayern Munich's Douglas Costa in addition to Salah and Martins.

Don Hutchison identifies the player Liverpool should sign after ending their interest in Southampton's Virgil van Dijk

Aiden Cusick@aidencusick 11 minutes ago

Liverpool are expected to seek alternatives to the Southampton defender.

Former Liverpool midfielder Don Hutchison has identified the player to whom the Reds should turn instead of Virgil van Dijk.

Liverpool were reported to have agreed terms with the Southampton defender, but released a statement on Wednesday in which they apologised for "any misunderstanding" and announced they had ended their interest, as the Premier League prepared to investigate a possible illegal approach.

Jurgen Klopp's side are now expected to turn to alternatives, having conceded the most goals of any top four club this past Premier League campaign.

And when asked on Twitter to name his preferred choice, Hutchison replied:

Tah is a player who should be well known to Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp, having made his Bundesliga breakthrough while the 49-year-old was in charge of Borussia Dortmund.

And the 21-year-old, who has been capped three times by Germany's national team, was linked with a move to Anfield at the turn of the year.

nter Milan have requested extra time from Atalanta before they take a decision on making a bid for Liverpool linked defender Andrea Conti.

The 23-year-old defender is edging closer to the exit door at Atalanta and despite interest from clubs such as Chelsea and Liverpool, it seems he will be staying in Italy.


AC Milan are set to meet Atalanta and his agent later today to discuss the possibility of signing Conti and it has been suggested that the defender is angling for a move to the Rossoneri.

Inter are also interested in the Italy international and are aware that AC Milan currently have the edge in the chase for the young defender in the summer.



According to Italian broadcaster Sportitalia, the Nerazzurri have requested Atalanta wait until next Tuesday before they agree to sell the player to any club.

Inter are keen to buy time before they prepare an offer that could rival AC Milan’s proposal and hope to turn Conti’s head from moving to the Rossoneri.

Conti, who made his debut for Italy against San Marino last week, has a contract until 2021 with the club.

Danny Ward has revealed he wants to return to Huddersfield Town on loan next season but admits the final decision rests with Liverpool.

Ward: "Promotion has changed things. It is a chance to go and play in the Premier League at a club where you know the place, they know you."

Ward: "It is kind of out of my hands at the minute. As it stands I am going back to Liverpool for pre-season and have a bit of competition."

Ward: "I have competition with the others. But this time of year you haven't got a clue what's round the corner, take each day as it comes."

Ward: "I'm not a Huddersfield Town player. I belong to Liverpool and no matter what I think or David thinks, Liverpool are my club."

Ward: "Anything with Huddersfield would be a loan deal. These aren't just my thoughts because I have a contract at Liverpool."

Ward: "Anything with Huddersfield would be a loan deal. These aren't just my thoughts because I have a contract at Liverpool."

Roma are considering a move for Liverpool Academy product Suso as they prepare for the likely departure of Mohamed Salah to Liverpool, according to Gianluca Di Marzio from Sky Italy.

Reports yesterday suggested that Liverpool had moved on from Salah in their attempts to sign a winger this summer, with the club supposedly in talks to sign Sporting Lisbon wonderkid Gelson Martins. Liverpool’s initial Â£28m bid for Salah was rejected last Friday and it was reported yesterday that Roma want over Â£40m for the Egyptian star.

But claims in Italy today suggest those reports are false, with Roma only looking for a fee in the region of Â£35m and the feeling in Italy is that Salah’s proposed move to Liverpool is still likely to go ahead. Personal terms have been agreed and it’s even been reported that the player met Jurgen Klopp a few days ago.

It appears Roma are eyeing up a swoop for Suso, who enjoyed a successful 2016/17 campaign with current club AC Milan, helping them to a finish in a Europa League spot with 7 goals and 9 assists in all competitions.

However, Vincenzo Montella’s side have already made a host of summer signings with the club reportedly now eyeing up moves for Keita Balde Diao, who’s been linked to Liverpool, and Chelsea striker Diego Costa, meaning Suso could become surplus to requirements.

Liverpool end Virgil van Dijk interest and apologise to Southampton
By Lyall Thomas

Last Updated: 08/06/17 9:58am


ä¹–å“¢

Southampton are happy with Liverpool's apology over their attempts to sign Virgil van Dijk and consider the matter closed, Sky Sports News HQ understands.

Representatives from both clubs are meeting face-to-face on Thursday afternoon at a scheduled Premier League board meeting in Harrogate and Sky Sports News HQ understands Liverpool's very public climb-down means Southampton consider the dispute at an end.

Liverpool confirmed on Wednesday that they had ended their interest in signing Van Dijk and apologised to Southampton for their conduct in the pursuit of the Netherlands defender.

Prior to the apology, Southampton had reported Liverpool to the Premier League and asked them to investigate an alleged illegal approach.

The Premier League subsequently confirmed it was looking into the matter, but Sky sources understand that, as far as the league is concerned, the apology is the end of the matter and they are unlikely to take any further action.
Jurgen Klopp has apologised for Liverpool's pursuit of Virgil van Dijk

Liverpool, whose manager Jurgen Klopp has been taking a central role in summer recruitment, said on Wednesday: "Liverpool would like to put on record our regret over recent media speculation regarding Southampton Football Club and player transfers between the two clubs.

"We apologise to the owner, board of directors and fans of Southampton for any misunderstanding regarding Virgil van Dijk. We respect Southampton's position and can confirm we have ended any interest in the player."

Van Dijk has also attracted significant interest from Premier League champions Chelsea and Manchester City.
Van Dijk suffered an ankle injury in January and missed the remainder of the 2016-17 campaign
Van Dijk suffered an ankle injury in January and missed the remainder of the 2016-17 campaign

Southampton manager Claude Puel and the club's chairman Ralph Krueger have previously insisted Van Dijk will not be allowed to leave St Mary's in the summer.

The 25-year-old was rewarded with a new six-year contract in May 2016 and was named Saints captain following the departure of Jose Fonte to West Ham in January.

Van Dijk, who joined Southampton from Celtic in September 2015, made 30 appearances last season before suffering a season-ending ankle injury in the 3-0 win over Leicester on January 22.
